results.title: The Accidental tourist
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Michael Grillo, Charles Okun and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Anne Tyler’s best-selling novel, this multi-award winning film tells the story of Macon Leary and his eccentric family who insulate themselves from the real, messy world of relationships by constructing an elaborate series of routines and protective behaviours. Until, that is, Macon meets Muriel and his sister Rose meets Macon’s publisher. By turns funny and heartbreakingly sad, this film will linger in your memory. Cast includes William Hurt, Kathleen Turner, Geena Davis and Bill Pullman.

results.title: The Return of the soldier
results.creator_credit: Alan Bridges, Simon Relph, Ann Skinner, Skreba Films, Barry R Cooper Productions and Brent Walker Film Productions
results.brief_description: It is 1916. A shell-shocked soldier (Alan Bates) is sent home to the tranquillity of his English estate, his beautiful but spoilt wife Kitty (Julie Christie) and adoring cousin (Ann-Margret). But he barely remembers Kitty and can only find happiness with his first love (Glenda Jackson), who is from a lower class and now married to a schoolteacher. Kitty, however, wants him back whatever the cost. Adapted by Hugh Whitemore from the novel by Rebecca West, with music by Richard Rodney Bennett. Also stars Frank Finlay and Ian Holm.

results.title: Dirty rotten scoundrels (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Bernard Williams and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: In Beaumont-sur-mer on the French Riviera, Lawrence Jamison (Michael Caine), a suave stylish con man who is an expert at extracting jewels from rich, married women must find a way to deal with crass new competition in the person of Freddy Benson (Steve Martin), a small time scam artist who tells tragic tales about his grandma to secure a few francs from almost anyone! Eventually they decide to compete and make a wager that whoever cannot swindle a certain naive soap heiress (Glenne Headly) for $50,000 must leave the French Riviera hunting ground. A remake of the 1964 “Bedtime stories”.

results.title: Beaches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Margaret Jennings South, Bette Midler, Bonnie Bruckheimer, South, Bruckheimer, Silver Screen Partners IV and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The chance meeting of two young girls from totally different backgrounds becomes the friendship of a lifetime. As they lead their separate lives, they come to realise and later rely on the strength that their friendship provides. Cast includes Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey and John Heard.

results.title: Curly Top (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Irving Cummings, Winfield Sheehan and Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Since the death of their parents, Mary Blair and her little sister Elizabeth have been inmates of a private orphanage. Mary promised her dying mother that she and Elizabeth, nicknamed “Curly Top” would never be separated. With a natural talent for singing and dancing Curly Top is a mischievous yet appealing child. Elizabeth gets into trouble during a visit of the trustees, one of them, a playboy bachelor is taken with her and decides to adopt her. The bachelor soon discovers Mary is part of the ‘deal’ and this leads to some embarrassing and often funny predicaments. Stars Shirley Temple, John Boles, Rochelle Hudson and Jane Darwell.

results.title: Being there
results.creator_credit: Hal Ashby, Andrew Braunsberg, United Artists Corporation and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: Chauncey Gardener is a feeble-minded gardener whose life is centred on watching television. When his benefactor dies he is let loose on a world of which he cannot make sense, and which he cannot change with the remote control. An accident brings him into contact with Washington diplomats and business people and the inanities Chauncey learned from television sound like profundities to them. Soon he has met the U.S. President and Chauncey is on his way to ruling the world. This little gem of a movie, with its savage black comedy and cynical perspective on U.S. politics was released on the eve of Reagan’s election to President. With Peter Sellers, Shirley MacLaine and Melvyn Douglas. Based on the book by Jerzy Kosinski.

results.title: The Times of Harvey Milk
results.creator_credit: Robert Epstein, Richard Schmiechen and Black Sand Productions
results.brief_description: An exceptionally moving documentary about Harvey Milk, the first openly gay candidate elected to San Francisco’s Board of Supervisors. A courageous activist, Milk worked hard to express the political concerns of not only gays and lesbians, but also of African-Americans, Hispanics and other so- called American minorities. After 11 months in office, Milk and the Mayor of San Francisco were assassinated by Dan White, a conservative member of the Board of Supervisors. The subsequent trial, in which White received a lenient sentence, resulted in massive rioting in San Francisco by gay and lesbian activists. Amidst the tragedy the film builds a convincing and impassioned picture of a man committed to human rights and human dignity. (Awards: Academy Award winner for best documentary, 1985)

results.title: Crimes of passion
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell, Donald P. Borchers, Barry Sandler and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: Kathleen Turner leads a double life in this film by Ken Russell. By day she is Joanna, a sportswear designer, but by night she transforms herself to China-Blue, a hooker servicing a variety of sexual fantasies. Among her regular clients is a sinister preacher (Anthony Perkins) who carries his obsession with China-Blue to a chilling extreme.

results.title: Room service
results.creator_credit: William A. Seiter, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers are penniless Broadway producers, living in a hotel, who are planning a new stage show and are waiting for the finance to come through. As their hotel room becomes packed by members of the cast and the hotel bill escalates, the Marx Brothers devise a number of schemes to avoid eviction by the hotel’s management. Also stars Lucille Ball.

results.title: Moonlighting
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Skolimowski, Mark Shivas, Michael White and Centar Film
results.brief_description: Three Polish builders and their foreman, Nowak, (Jeremy Irons), the only one to speak English, enter Britain illegally to renovate the home of a rich fellow Pole. All goes according to plan, but it is December 1981, time of the military crackdown in Poland and Nowak, the only one to find out, decides not to tell the others. Things start to go badly wrong, the workers are restless, money begins to run out, and Nowak resorts to increasingly desperate measures to keep everything under control. A Cannes Film Festival award winner.
